19.parse: Reflexive Pronoun - Genitive Masculine 3rd Person Singular

19.str2: Body, flesh; the body of the Church. From sozo; the body, used in a very wide application, literally or figuratively.

19.parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Singular
19.str2: To begin, am, exist, be in possession. From hupo and archomai; to begin under, i.e. Come into existence; expletively, to exist (verb).
Genitive case of an indefinite pronoun pos otherwise obsolete; as adverb of place, somewhere, i.e. Nearly.
A hundred years old. From hekaton and etos; centenarian.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
(a) putting to death, (b) dead or lifeless condition. From nekroo; decease; figuratively, impotency.
Sarah, wife of Abraham. Of Hebrew origin; Sarra, the wife of Abraham.
The womb. From meter; the matrix.

20.str2: A primary particle; but, and, etc.

20.parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Passive - 3rd Person Singular
20.str2: From dia and krino; to separate thoroughly, i.e. to withdraw from, or oppose; figuratively, to discriminate, or hesitate.
Unbelief, unfaithfulness, distrust. From apistos; faithlessness, i.e. disbelief, or unfaithfulness.
A primary preposition; to or into, of place, time, or purpose; also in adverbial phrases.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A promise. From epaggello; an announcement.
A deity, especially the supreme Divinity; figuratively, a magistrate; by Hebraism, very.
But, except, however. Neuter plural of allos; properly, other things, i.e. contrariwise.

20.parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Passive - 3rd Person Singular
20.str2: To fill with power, strengthen, make strong. From en and dunamoo; to empower.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Faith, belief, trust, confidence; fidelity, faithfulness.

20.parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Singular
20.str2: To offer, give; I put, place. A prolonged form of a primary verb; to give.
From the base of dokeo; glory, in a wide application.
A deity, especially the supreme Divinity; figuratively, a magistrate; by Hebraism, very.

21.parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Passive - Nominative Masculine Singular
21.str2: From pleres and phoreo; to carry out fully, i.e. Completely assure, entirely accomplish.

21.parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
21.str2: I am, exist. The first person singular present indicative; a prolonged form of a primary and defective verb; I exist.
(a) of persons: powerful, able, (b) of things: possible. From dunamai; powerful or capable; neuter possible.
(a) I make, manufacture, construct, (b) I do, act, cause. Apparently a prolonged form of an obsolete primary; to make or do.

21.parse: Personal / Relative Pronoun - Accusative Neuter Singular
Verb - Perfect Indicative Middle or Passive - 3rd Person Singular
21.str2: From epi and the base of aggelos; to announce upon, i.e. to engage to do something, to assert something respecting oneself.

22.str2: Wherefore, on which account, therefore. From dia and hos; through which thing, i.e. Consequently.

22.parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Passive - 3rd Person Singular
22.str2: To reckon, count, charge with; reason, decide, conclude; think, suppose.

22.parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Dative Masculine 3rd Person Singular
22.str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
A primary preposition; to or into, of place, time, or purpose; also in adverbial phrases.

23.str2: A primary particle; but, and, etc.
Neuter of hostis as conjunction; demonstrative, that; causative, because.

23.parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Passive - 3rd Person Singular
23.str2: To reckon, count, charge with; reason, decide, conclude; think, suppose.

23.parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Dative Masculine 3rd Person Singular
23.str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.

23.parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Passive - 3rd Person Singular
23.str2: A primary verb; to 'grave', especially to write; figuratively, to describe.
No, not. Also ouk, and ouch a primary word; the absolute negative adverb; no or not.
Alone, but, only. Neuter of monos as adverb; merely.
A primary preposition denoting the channel of an act; through.

23.parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative Masculine 3rd Person Singular
23.str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.

24.str2: But, except, however. Neuter plural of allos; properly, other things, i.e. contrariwise.
A primary preposition denoting the channel of an act; through.

24.parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative 1st Person Plural
24.str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.

24.parse: Personal / Relative Pronoun - Dative Masculine Plural
Verb - Present Infinitive Middle or Passive
24.str2: To reckon, count, charge with; reason, decide, conclude; think, suppose.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.

24.parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Dative Masculine Plural
24.str2: From pistis; to have faith, i.e. Credit; by implication, to entrust.
On, to, against, on the basis of, at.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.

24.parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Active - Accusative Masculine Singular
24.str2: (a) I wake, arouse, (b) I raise up. Probably akin to the base of agora; to waken, i.e. Rouse.
Of Hebrew origin; Jesus, the name of our Lord and two other Israelites.

24.parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive 1st Person Plural
24.str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.
Lord, master, sir; the Lord. From kuros; supreme in authority, i.e. controller; by implication, Master.
From out, out from among, from, suggesting from the interior outwards. A primary preposition denoting origin, from, out.
(a) adj: dead, lifeless, subject to death, mortal, (b) noun: a dead body, a corpse. From an apparently primary nekus; dead.

25.parse: Personal / Relative Pronoun - Nominative Masculine Singular
Verb - Aorist Indicative Passive - 3rd Person Singular
25.str2: From para and didomi; to surrender, i.e yield up, intrust, transmit.
A primary preposition denoting the channel of an act; through.

25.parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive 1st Person Plural
25.str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.
A falling away, lapse, slip, false step, trespass, sin. From parapipto; a side-slip, i.e. error or transgression.

25.parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Passive - 3rd Person Singular
25.str2: (a) I wake, arouse, (b) I raise up. Probably akin to the base of agora; to waken, i.e. Rouse.
A primary preposition denoting the channel of an act; through.

25.parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive 1st Person Plural
25.str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.
Acquittal, justifying, justification, a process of absolution. From dikaioo; aquittal.
